availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin W. Blincoe (Lexington, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. 11th Kentucky Cav - Lieut)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin C. Blincoe and Lydia B. Blincoe. Married to Anna R. Curtis Blincoe in Fayette County, Kentucky, on November 27, 1860. Father of Benjamin Blincoe. Attended school in Fayette County in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Resident of Lexington in 1860. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 22, 1862, to March 6, 1863. Clerk in Lexington in July 1863.
